result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy D Marty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia, alcohol and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with International Machinery Exchange.
No objection. Order to be signed.
Random UA & BA testing at minimum of every 2 weeks. DNA on file.
